main_definition: Every individual in a particular group, place or situation without exception.

meanings_and_examples.example: When the teacher said 'Everybody needs to be here for the test,' she meant every single student.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to express an action or behavior that applies universally or is common among a group of individuals.
meanings_and_examples.example: It's not unusual for everybody to say 'hello' when they enter a room in many cultures.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Implies inclusiveness and absence of exclusivity; an all-encompassing term that includes every person or thing.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Everybody is invited to the party,' meant no one was left out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sometimes used informally to suggest a sense of camaraderie among people, as if they are all friends or part of the same group.
meanings_and_examples.example: The band 'Everybody's Friends' is known for their inclusive and uplifting music.
